module.p:
uan beag a little lamb –
Bha an crodh blàth le teas na gréine agus bha iad ’nan seasamh anns na lochan beaga a bha an siud ’s an seo air feadh a’ mhonaidh. Bha na h-uain bheaga a’ leum agus a’ cluich mu thimcheall am màthraichean.
The cattle were warm with the heat of the sun and they were standing in the little lakes which were here and there throughout the moor. The little lambs were jumping and playing about their mothers. td. 146

uan ann am monadh ... a lamb on a moor –
Nuair a ràinig Màiri agus Seumas am monadh, bha na cìobairean aig an fhang agus stad Màiri mionaid no dhà a’ coimhead air na caoraich agus air na h-uain.
When Mary and James reached the moor, the shepherds were at the fank and Mary stopped for a minute or two looking at the sheep and at the lambs. td. 76

caora agus uan a sheep and a lamb –
Nuair a ràinig Màiri agus Seumas am monadh, bha na cìobairean aig an fhang agus stad Màiri mionaid no dhà a’ coimhead air na caoraich agus air na h-uain.
When Mary and James reached the moor, the shepherds were at the fank and Mary stopped for a minute or two looking at the sheep and at the lambs. td. 76

uan agus cìobair a lamb and a shepherd –
Nuair a ràinig Màiri agus Seumas am monadh, bha na cìobairean aig an fhang agus stad Màiri mionaid no dhà a’ coimhead air na caoraich agus air na h-uain.
When Mary and James reached the moor, the shepherds were at the fank and Mary stopped for a minute or two looking at the sheep and at the lambs. td. 76

uan ann am fang a lamb in a fank –
Nuair a ràinig Màiri agus Seumas am monadh, bha na cìobairean aig an fhang agus stad Màiri mionaid no dhà a’ coimhead air na caoraich agus air na h-uain.
When Mary and James reached the moor, the shepherds were at the fank and Mary stopped for a minute or two looking at the sheep and at the lambs. td. 76

màthair uain a lamb’s mother –
Bha an crodh blàth le teas na gréine agus bha iad ’nan seasamh anns na lochan beaga a bha an siud ’s an seo air feadh a’ mhonaidh. Bha na h-uain bheaga a’ leum agus a’ cluich mu thimcheall am màthraichean.
The cattle were warm with the heat of the sun and they were standing in the little lakes which were here and there throughout the moor. The little lambs were jumping and playing about their mothers. td. 146

leum uan a lamb jumps –
Bha an crodh blàth le teas na gréine agus bha iad ’nan seasamh anns na lochan beaga a bha an siud ’s an seo air feadh a’ mhonaidh. Bha na h-uain bheaga a’ leum agus a’ cluich mu thimcheall am màthraichean.
The cattle were warm with the heat of the sun and they were standing in the little lakes which were here and there throughout the moor. The little lambs were jumping and playing about their mothers. td. 146

cluich uan a lamb plays –
Bha an crodh blàth le teas na gréine agus bha iad ’nan seasamh anns na lochan beaga a bha an siud ’s an seo air feadh a’ mhonaidh. Bha na h-uain bheaga a’ leum agus a’ cluich mu thimcheall am màthraichean.
The cattle were warm with the heat of the sun and they were standing in the little lakes which were here and there throughout the moor. The little lambs were jumping and playing about their mothers. td. 146

coimhead ... air uan ... looks at a lamb –
Nuair a ràinig Màiri agus Seumas am monadh, bha na cìobairean aig an fhang agus stad Màiri mionaid no dhà a’ coimhead air na caoraich agus air na h-uain.
When Mary and James reached the moor, the shepherds were at the fank and Mary stopped for a minute or two looking at the sheep and at the lambs. td. 76
